job_profile: Purchasing Manager for a remodeling company
job_description:
Manhattan Home Remodeling Company seeks Purchasing Manager with experience in the kitchen and bath industry.  
 
Job Description: 
1. Place orders for materials for home renovation jobs, mainly kitchen, bath, and flooring materials. 
2. Establish and develop great working relationships with vendors. 
3. Maintain full kitchen and bath displays in Manhattan showroom, as well as vendor and manufacturer sample stock.  
4. Work with Designers and Project Managers to ensure materials are ordered and delivered in a timely manner. 
5. Manage warehouse inventory as well as driver scheduling. 
6. Work with accounting to ensure purchase orders are handled properly and paid in a timely manner. 
 
Requirements:

2. Must have Quickbooks experience and be proficient in Microsoft Office/Outlook.

This is a full-time position, salary TBD and based on experience.  
Please email resume and we will contact for an interview.

job_profile: Project Manager for Luxury Home Technology A/V Company
job_description:
***ATTENTION PROJECT MANAGERS IN CONSTRUCTION AND RELATED FIELDS LOOKING FOR A NEW CHALLENGE*** 
 
Do you have experience managing projects, working with clients, designers, architects, and engineers? Do you love technology? Are you looking for a place to grow your career in the exciting home technology integration industry? 
 
Osbee Industries, Inc. is a home integration company serving highly affluent residential clients in the New York/Westchester area. We continue to grow and are looking for smart, curious, versatile problem solvers to join our team. 
 
As a Project Manager, you will be involved in multiple jobs every step of the way, from initial client meetings to the final walkthrough. We work with some of the most elite architecture and interior design firms in the country. Every project we take on is custom-designed and engineered specifically for the needs of each client, so you will always be learning new things and be looked to for creative solutions -- you will never be bored. 
 
THE EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS THAT MAKE YOU THE PERFECT PERSON FOR THIS JOB: 
 
- Experience or interest in residential or commercial integration, A/V, and/or electronic control systems 
- At least 3 years hands-on PM skills in managing multiple projects from start to finish 
- Excellent communication skills, and extremely fluent English writing, grammar, and speaking abilities 
- Highly organized with a natural and exceptional ability to work with many different teams and solve problems in a collaborative way 
- Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook. Visio and AutoCAD proficiency a plus. 
- Knowledge of low-voltage, lighting, and/or control systems (such as Crestron or Savant) a major plus 
 
WHAT YOU'LL DO ON THE JOB: 
 
- Meet with clients, including architects, interior designers, builders, owner's representatives, and homeowners on a regular basis at all phases of the project 
- Manage project workflow and schedules on multiple jobs at various stages of completion 
- Work closely with our engineering/estimating, billing, and customer service teams to prepare estimates for proposals, and purchase orders, change orders/billing for approved projects 
- Coordinate with our technicians, installers, IT, inventory, and support staff to ensure deadlines are being planned for and met 
- Review AutoCAD blueprints, plans, and notes from architects, contractors, and sub-contractors 
- Develop low-voltage plans, RCPs, shade pocket plans, home theater elevations, etc. using Visio or AutoCAD with assistance from our AutoCAD artist 
- Work closely with Osbee technicians/Installers as well as multiple contractors and sub-contractors to answer questions and solve problems as they arise 
- Make regular site visits to our clients in New York City, Westchester NY, Fairfield CT, and occasionally other locations 
- Attend webinars, Osbee seminars, and industry trainings to stay on the cutting edge of what we do 
 
OTHER DETAILS ABOUT THIS POSITION: 
 
- PM experience specifically in the A/V Home Integration industry is desired but not necessary - we will teach you what you need to know 
- You must be able to lift up to 25 pounds 
- A US driver's license with a clean driving record is required 
- You must be able to work in the US without sponsorship now or in the future 
 
ABOUT OSBEE: 
 
Osbee is the leading residential home integrator on the East Coast. Established 20 years ago, we pride ourselves on having a team of professionals that is the best in the industry. We're a Platinum Elite Crestron dealer, have won numerous awards, and we get to play with all the coolest toys before anyone else. 
 
BENEFITS: 
 
Osbee provides competitive benefits, including health insurance, optional dental and optical, a 401(k) with matching after one year, 9 paid holidays, and 16 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) per year. We provide support for seminars, certification trainings, and other educational opportunities you'd like to pursue in order to stay at the top of your game and move it forward. And if you apply soon enough you may just make it in time to attend our annual Spring Paintball Party. 
 
LOCATION: 
 
This is a full-time position at our headquarters/showroom in Harrison, New York, easily accessible by car via 95 and the Hutchinson Parkway, and within walking distance from Metro North's Harrison station. 
 
IMPORTANT -- HOW TO APPLY: 
 
- Please submit your resume 
- Please provide a cover letter or email message with your resume to tell us what interests you in working with Osbee and why you are the perfect candidate to join our team.

job_profile: Highly Experienced Draftsman Needed by Interior Design Firm
job_description:
High-end residential interior design firm seeks highly experienced draftsman to produce very detailed design and construction drawings in CAD. 
 
Traditional design experience required. Attention to detail is essential. 
 
Ability to take direction from the Principal and Senior Architectural Designers a must, as well as problem-solving and taking initiative. You will prepare design documents working in a fast-paced environment where meticulous work is expected. 
 
 
REQUIREMENTS: 
 
•	Expertise in AutoCAD 2015 -- skills to be tested 
•	Fluent in Photoshop, Microsoft Office, and Acrobat 
•	Extensive experience in drafting floor plans, elevations, specifications, and custom details 
•	Must be available to occasionally assist project managers on site 
•	Strong communication skills 
 
 
Please email resume and portfolio. 
 
We look forward to hearing from you!

BUILD PROJECT MANAGER 
 
The Build Project Manager is responsible for the supervision and administration of individual MADE construction projects. The Build Project Manager will have experience in high-end design work with architects, owners, and contractors, will have experience with fabrication and construction, and will have knowledge of masonry, structural steel, plumbing and electrical work.  Additionally, the Build Project Manager will have excellent organizational skills and will be responsible for maintaining order on MADE's construction jobs and serving as the liaison between MADE and their clients.  Finally, the Build Project Manager will be a leader with the ability to motivate, energize, and manage MADE's staff, negotiate with sub-contractors, and help advance the construction services at MADE. 
 
On a day to day basis, the Build Project Manager will coordinate subcontractors and MADE personnel and will ensure that the work is being performed as per the Contract Documents. The Build Project Manager will also be responsible for troubleshooting problems that arise during the course of a project. The Build Project Manager will schedule work on site, organize and plan for material deliveries, and schedule major phases of the work. The Build Project Manager will be responsible for the on-site coordination of these various items and arrangements for their arrival. As time permits, the Build Project Manager will be responsible for participating on-site construction and installation. As the scope of work increases, the Build Project Manager's responsibilities will become more supervisory and less participatory. It is the responsibility of the Build Project Manager to ensure the efficient progression of work on the job site. 
 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
Project Administration:  
- Review project documents including construction drawings, SK's and shop drawings  
- Develop Project Scope of work  
- Produce Project Control Estimates 
- Produce Project Schedule Estimates   
- Produce Subcontractor documentation including RFP's and MADE Subcontractor Agreements  
- Review and approve subcontractor applications for payment 
- Produce Applications for payment for submittal to clients   
- Maintain project documentation, including product submittals  
- Procure tools, materials, fixtures and appliances  as required by the contract documents  
- Provide weekly site updates and workplan  
	 
Project Worksite:  
- Develop and coordinate sequence of construction 
- Communicate and Coordinate onsite needs with subcontractors and vendors    
- Maintain site safety protocols  
- Coordinate and execute site work plan  
- Establish and Maintain project labor efficiency  
- Provide quality control during all subcontractor and MADEshop Installations

Requirements:  
• AUTOCAD 2-D proficiency , Revit a plus but not required 
• Experience producing construction documents, detailing and millwork 
• Design skills in both contemporary and traditional modes  
• 3-5 Years architectural experience in the tristate area  
 
We will only respond to qualified applications that follow all instructions. Please apply directly through this site. No phone calls. 
 
Apply with: 
- brief cover letter  
- resume of related experience  
- work samples including construction documents and details 
 
Additional information:  
- You must be legal to work in the US [We do not sponsor visa requests]  
- Medical-Dental-Vision Insurance coverage  
- 3 week paid time off 
- Flexible hours after 6 months 
 
Principals only.  
Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster. 
Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers 
Equal Opportunity Employer

job_profile: Mechanical Engineer - GeoCV Inc, New York, New York
job_description:
GeoCV is seeking an Engineer to fill the role of Mechanical Engineer and join our Research & Development Department. The selected individual will be involved with the design, inspection, and development of a wide variety of electrical and mechanical systems from motorized panoramic heads, 3D scanners, and other devices related to GeoCV's field of work. The individual will collaborate with multi-disciplined teams composed of designers, developers, mechanical, and electrical engineers, and be supervised by executive developers in their assignments.  
 
The selected candidate will be in New York, NY but may work remotely from home occasionally. The candidate would be expected to perform the following: 
 
• Perform engineering design calculations; 
• Assist with the design, development, testing, and deployment of our propitiatory hardware technology 
• Develop details, quantities and estimates; 
• Ensure that parts and components used can be sourced locally 
• Assist other engineers in various tasks and duties including field inspection work. 
 
Bachelor's degree in Engineering 
• 1-3 years of Mechanical Engineering and/or Electrical Engineering experience preferred; 
• Basic knowledge of MS Office software; 
• Proficient in AutoCAD, MicroStation, and/or other CAD/BIM program; 
• Willing to travel and perform field work indoor/outdoor that may require data collection on performance of modules 
• Good communication skills both verbal and written. 
• Ability to work and integrate well in a faster paced startup environment. 
 
Combination Office and Field Environment: Most work is performed in an office/home environment in which there is only minimal exposure to potentially unpleasant working conditions. Incumbent must have the ability to stand and sit frequently and reach horizontally as well as vertically for overhead use. Work may infrequently be performed at clients job site and in the field. 
  
GeoCV Inc, is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. 
 
GeoCV Inc, are an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, marital status, genetic information, citizenship status, or other status protected by law. In compliance with the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, we will hire only U.S. citizens and aliens lawfully authorized to work in the United States (if the position is or will be one which is subject to U.S. law). We will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individual with a disability where appropriate. 
 
Please no calls or walk-ins.

SITE SUPERVISOR 
 
The Site Supervisor is responsible first and foremost for the quality execution on site for MADE's construction projects.  The responsibilities start with maintaining a clean and well-organized job site.  The Site Super will be responsible for making sure safety is paramount on the job site by monitoring both the site conditions and the work habits of MADE personnel and subcontractors.  The Site Super is also responsible for coordinating the daily work and maintaining a log of daily progress. 
 
On a day to day basis the Site Super will coordinate subcontractors and MADE personnel, and will ensure that the work is being performed as per the Contract Documents.  If questions of quality come up, the Site Super will be the first arbiter.  The Site Super will also be responsible for trouble-shooting problems that arise during the course of a project with the assistance of the Build Project Manager.  The Site Super will work together with the Build Project Manager to schedule work on site, to organize and plan for material deliveries, and to schedule major phases of the work.  The Site Super will be responsible for the on-site coordination of these various items after the Build Project Manager has arranged for their arrival.  As time permits, the Site Supervisor will be responsible for participating on-site construction and installation.  On smaller construction jobs the Site Super may be solely responsible for the completion of minor carpentry work.  As the scope of work increases, the Site Super's responsibilities will become more supervisory and less participatory.  It is the responsibility of the Site Super, with the assistance of the Build Project Manager, to ensure the efficient progression of work on the job site. 
 
Finally, the Site Super will be responsible for maintaining MADE's site tools and infrastructure located at MADE's shop.  All supplies, tools, and materials will be kept in good order and a regular inventory of stock will be taken and maintained.  This will be coordinated with the Build Project Manager and assistance will be provided by the shop assistant.  
 
 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
Daily: 
- Check in with Build Project Manager for any project specific updates 
- Coordinate subcontractors and deliveries 
- Trouble shoot and deal with any daily issues 
- Participate in any on-site construction as time permits 
- Complete a daily site log of job site activity 
 
Weekly: 
- Meet with Build Project Manager and PIC 
- Submit daily plan of work for the next week 
- Clean job site and take stock of project progress 
 
Monthly: 
- Organize shop tools and supplies at MADE's shop 
- Assist Build Project Manager with overall project schedule

WHO WE ARE: MIDI is an established Award Winning Product Development firm located in Smithtown, NY specializing in innovative product engineering and design solutions for the medical, industrial, consumer and scientific markets. With over 45 years of product development consulting experience, having served clientele representing diverse industries both in the US and internationally, our success is based on our multi-disciplined, talented team. And, we are seeking additional team members! 
 
WHO WE SEEK: Here is a basic description of how our instruments are typically structured and the type of skill-set we would be looking for in a Senior Engineer: 
 
Starting from a high-level, the systems are typically controlled by Windows 7E on an off-the-shelf SBC.  Within the Windows environment we need to develop a program and GUI to control the instrument using C#.NET.  The SBC will then instruct our "Main Embedded PCB" on tasks it needs to perform.  This Main-PCB will control/sense a combination of both analogue and digital components like PID-Heating, stepper motors, pumps, RTD, TC, optical & hall interrupts, etc.  We will need to generate schematics/layout/BOM on this PCB along with the C-code firmware to control the components.  Successful Engineers at MIDI are involved in the conceptualization and development of new and innovative products and work directly on-site as a team member and with our client's staff. Your role will be to design and prototype designs using EDA software and testing and improving upon designs. 
 
WHO YOU ARE: You should possess a BS or MS and ideally 5+ years of Experience.   Additionally, you are enthusiastic, creative and a hands-on person.  As a strategic, critical and analytical thinker, you are creative at problem solving, intellectually curious, independent, self-starting and proactive. You are comfortable having daily contact with the company owners and can manage programs involving engineering/product development with ease. 
If you are interested, please reply to this posting with only a PDF resume. No jpegs or photos please. We look forward to hearing from you!

job_profile: Construction Manager: high volume single family flipping/rental co
job_description:
We are seeking a unique person to help run our construction department. 
 
We are a single family real estate company.  Our HQ is in Manhattan but our projects are in various cities in the Southeast.    We buy distressed SFR on the courthouse steps or through off-market deals, rehab the houses and either sell retail as 'flips' or keep for our rental portfolio.   In 2017, we had 90 closings and in 2018, we already have over 50 houses in inventory, so we should do around 150 to 200 closings.  Also, we sometimes build single family from the ground up (around 30 new construction closings in 2017).   
 
FYI, We have more of a tech startup culture than a stereotypical real estate culture.  We are fairly laid back but only hire people who are team players. 
 
Your job is to remotely manage our projects from our office in Midtown.   
 
Depending on our volume in a certain city, we either have a dedicated full time field superintendent or we hire freelance contractors to run the projects.  You are responsible for managing them to make sure they do the job correctly and also follow our SOPs and use our tech platform to manage the jobs. 
 
You will work with our field team to do scopes of work, calculate budgets, draft contracts, order materials, and keep the schedule on track and up to date. 
 
You will also be responsible for cost accounting to make sure that the job finishes, forgive the cliche, "both on time and on budget" 
 
We have "ok" standard operating procedures in place but it is difficult to ensure that remote team members follow these.  
 
Knowledge and skills required for the job: 
 
- Formal construction management or contract administration experience required 
- Good knowledge of residential construction 
- Know the steps to build a house from the ground up 
- Good IT skills -- fast typing, spreadsheet formulas, etc 
- Knowledge of accounting and bookkeeping software (quickbooks) 
- Organized, patient, and methodical personality type 
- Reasonably intelligent 
- Degree in architecture, engineering, etc, is preferred 
 
Some travel is required - site visits (day trips) once every couple of weeks 
 
TO APPLY, complete the below Google Form.  Replies via email will be COMPLETELY IGNORED.

job_description:
We are seeking a smart, reliable, and enthusiastic person to help with our home acquisitions 
 
We are a small family owned SFR real estate company. Our HQ is in Manhattan but our projects are in various cities in the Southeast. We buy distressed SFR on the courthouse steps or through off-market deals, rehab the houses and either sell retail as 'flips' or keep for our rental portfolio.   
 
Your job title would be "junior acquisitions analyst" - this is a position suitable for a recent college graduate who has had some sort of internship or other real estate experience. 
 
Your job is to help us buy houses that fit our purchase criteria.  These houses come from various sources - foreclosure auctions, REO listings, distressed for sale by owner, bulk packages from smaller aggregators, etc.  You will be responsible for determining if a deal fits our criteria and also for actually buying houses yourself when appropriate. 
 
You will also be responsible for doing typical 'analyst' work such as assisting with fundraising, editing pitch decks, financial modeling, pro formas, basic investor relations, etc. 
 
Skills required: 
 
- Good people skills (you will be negotiating, writing offers, etc) 
- Analytical skills - able to do research, use common sense and deductive reasoning (e.g., "oh, that house has power lines and a weird addition in the back so the value should be less") 
- Research and quick Googling skills - title research, tax research, a lot of work on public records websites 
- IT skills, fast typing, etc, etc 
 
I am posting this job in DBA/tech as well because it would be a huge plus if you had tech skills plus all of the above.  You could help integrate new markets into our system and be a huge help with product management/QA, testing, etc. 
 
How to apply: 
 
Fill out this brief Google form and we will get back with you: 
 
 
 
Any applications not submitted via the above form will be completely ignored and scornfully deleted :)

Tristate Plumbing is looking to bring a new member aboard the Tristate Plumbing team. We are currently looking for an Associate Project Manager. 
 
There are two sides to every project we complete: the construction side and the business side. The Associate Project Manager will be responsible for the business end of the project. 
 
Responsibilities include: 
 
Working closely with our field project managers on the day-to-day field operations in order to understand the projects' needs and what their jobs require through the various stages. 
 
Working with engineers to confirm Tristate Plumbing is using the appropriate materials, equipment, tools, and complex tests for the project. 
 
Handling all the financial aspects of the project (purchasing, change orders, scope of work) and making sure the project is being performed to its fullest from a financial standpoint. The Associate Project Manager will negotiate with supply houses, and effectively convey to clients the cost implications of various revisions (plans and on-site). 
 
Coordinating a smooth transition between our clients and the end user. 
 
Teamwork, communication, and organizational skills are a must. 
Plumbing supply house experience is strongly beneficial.

job_profile: Career Opportunity in Tech and Engineering  for Immigrant Professional
compensation: This is a free training program
job_description:
Career Opportunities in IT, Technology and Engineering industries for Immigrant Professionals  
 
The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers at CAMBA assists highly skilled immigrant professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering. Courses are scheduled around the needs of working professionals and offered evenings and weekends.  
Since its inception in 1987, the Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers has taught over 4,500 students and helped connect more than 3,600 to science, technology and engineering jobs.  
 
ALL SERVICES ARE FREE. 
 
Classes include: 
 
Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety 
Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulation 
Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition and Safety Regulation (HVAC) 
National Electrical Code (NEC) and Its Applications 
AISC Structural Steel Design 
ACI Structural Concrete Design 
OSHA 30 
Introduction to AutoCAD for Engineers 
Advanced AutoCAD and Revit 
Building Cost Estimating and Bridge, Highway, Railroad Engineering 
Linux (Unix) Administration 
Data Architecture Principles, Data Structure and SQL 
Java Programming 
Microsoft .Net and C# 
Software Quality Assurance - Manual and Automated Testing 
Android Software Development 
 
To be considered for the program applicants must: 
 
• Be born outside of the United States 
• Be authorized to work in the United States 
• Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin 
• Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years. (Exceptions for those in the U.S. more than five years may be made on a case-by-case basis) 
• Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education 
• Have intermediate+ English fluency 
• Demonstrate a financial need 
• Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search 
 
Please, see our web site www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining  for more information and application instructions.

Scenic Corporation of New York, a full service scene shop is seeking a Project Manager with experience planning, building and managing scenery construction for corporate events, tradeshows, special events, television, film, fashion and retail. 
 
SceniCorp  isn't just a construction company--our area expertise is drastically more interesting than that. At SceniCorp we build sets and scenery for large brand events such as product launches, entertainment sets, network upfronts, and corporate events. There are giant pieces of artwork, from the installations you see in stores for the holidays to the mesmerizing setups of concert stages, and much more in between. 
 
The Project Manager is completely responsible for multiple scenic construction projects from inception to completion. You will get to manage projects that will be seen by the public on big stages that are often for mainstream entertainment and major brands. No two projects will be the same, so the job will remain interesting and constantly present new challenges and problems to solve. As a Project Manager here, you will have a vast array of tools at your disposal to attack your assignments. Our 35,000+ sq. ft. shop features CNC Routing, Metal, Carpentry, Graphics, and Scenic departments for you to complete the majority of jobs completely in-house. You will be able to you apply your technical knowledge of different materials and building methods to come up with creative solutions to deliver time and cost-efficient projects. 
 
 
Job Description 
 
Complete responsibility for multiple projects from inception to completion: 
 
PROJECT PLANNING  
Develop construction strategy through communication with the client and supervisors. 
Create necessary working drawings and establish a materials list for the bidding process and purchasing.  
 
PROJECT SCHEDULE 
Establish and maintain a project schedule with daily goals and labor requirements. 
 
MANAGE PROJECT 
Communicate with Shop Foreman, providing detailed final plans & drawings. 
Coordinate requirements with CNC routing shop and graphics department. 
Track project progress and anticipate potential problems. 
 
ARRANGE LOAD-IN & STRIKES 
Coordinate trucking and crew requirements with Warehouse Manager & Logistics Manager. 
Prepare and continually update load-in & strike packing list and fire certificates. 
Communicate with Crew Chief, providing complete set of drawings and discuss potential issues. 
Monitor load-in & strike progress by maintaining communication with Crew Chief. 
 
FINAL REPORT 
Evaluate client satisfaction and debrief supervisors. Provide information for final billing. 
 
Job Requirements 
 
• Minimum of five years previous experience as a Project Manager in a theatrical or commercial set shop. 
• Strong management skills and a thorough understanding of theatrical construction layouts, techniques and materials.  
• Extremely organized, with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to tight deadlines without supervision. 
• Ability to anticipate and resolve issues with a sense of urgency and efficiency. 
• Fluent in AutoCAD, Microsoft Office 365. 
• Highly developed written and verbal communication skills required for interfacing with clients, management and co-workers. 
• Professional manner and appearance, articulate and capable of effective personal interaction. 
Salary commensurate with experience plus generous benefits package available. 
Please send a resume with industry references.

New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is seeking a recent graduate with an architecture or structural engineering degree and an interest in preservation of buildings and infrastructure.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls.   

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.   

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.   

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).   

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.   

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.   

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday.  

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).   

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.    

For additional information, visit our website at

job_description:
Mechanical Engineer, Electric Motor Expert 
 
ROM3 is a three-year-old medical technology company that has created and patented a revolutionary physical rehabilitation device (see our product video at rom3rehab.com).  We have brought our initial product to market and are now working on a new, portable version of our product. 
 
We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer with 10 years' experience working with electric motors. job_profile: Construction Site Safety Monitor Wanted - Consultant / Part Time
job_description:
JOB SUMMARY: 
 
Experienced Part Time or Retired Site Safety Professional Wanted for consulting work ASAP! Approximately 20 - 30 hours per month.  This is a 1099 independent contractor position. 
 
Credentials: OSHA 10/30 & Scaffold, Site Safety Manager Certification (SSM), Certified Safety Professional (CSP), or other relevant credentials (Preferred) 
 
Responsibilities include: 
•	Monitoring the implementation of Safety and Health policies, procedures, and Safety related programs of contractors currently working at PANYNJ - La Guardia.  
 
•	Monitors job sites for adherence to client's safety practices and policies. Identify potential OSHA violations, liability issues, and risk exposures. 
 
•	Perform safety compliance monitoring and write up reports stating observations and recommendations that may help our client reduce construction site risk to employees.  
 
•	Anticipated work load: Initial "ramp up" period 40 hours on site, then two site visits per month with two corresponding reports. 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
1. Monitor the development of safety and health policies, practices and procedures in compliance with governmental regulations including Federal, State, and Local laws and regulations, including, but not limited to OSHA. 
 
2. Provide guidance and best practices to personnel regarding facility specific issues relative to safety, environmental, and health programs and practices. 
 
3. Provide leadership and guidance to site production management, supervision and employees.  
 
4. Act as a contact for job sites regarding matters involving safety, environmental, and health.  
 
5. Inspect all worksites by visual observation to observe and report on potential violations of occupational safety, company policy, NAVSEA Standard Items, and OSHA. 
 
6. Document violations identified through electronic media and distribute to responsible parties and management personnel. 
 
7. Investigate occupational accidents and injuries to determine the cause of the accidents/injuries and ensure all required investigation forms are completed and submitted on time. 
 
8. Distribute and post safety awareness information. 
 
9. Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor. 
 
QUALIFICATIONS: 
1. Minimum five years experience in construction safety industry, ten or more years of construction experience preferred; however, will accept qualified candidates with less experience. 
 
2. Strong verbal, written, analytical, and persuasive skills and the ability to interact effectively with all levels of employees and management. 
 
3. Ability to discuss standard safety policy and procedures, and oversee team of site safety professionals. 
 
4. Knowledge of occupational hazards and safety precautions applicable to a variety of construction industry worksites. 
 
5. Ability to communicate effectively, both written and oral. 
 
6. Proficient knowledge of MS Word, Outlook, and Excel. 
 
7. Must have reliable transportation, a valid drivers license, current auto insurance, computer with printer and scanner. 
 
8. Must be able to pass drug test, government background check, and obtain SWAC clearance (www.secureworker.com).  A current TWIC/SIDA or other government security clearance card might also suffice. 
 
9. Available to be on-site as needed.  Must be reliable, able to work remotely, independently and able to meet due dates. 
EOE/AA/M/F/Disability/Vet
